posts.title: Could you be a Customs Officer? Could you spot a smuggler?
posts.title_plain: Could you be a Customs Officer? Could you spot a smuggler?
posts.content:
Could you do the job of a Customs Officer? This study involves watching a video clip of someone who may or may not be smuggling something onto a ferry, and answering some questions about the behaviour of the person in the clip.

Note: Please do not apply if you took part in the ‘How to Spot a Smuggler’ study between November 2015 and April 2016.

This study is open to staff and students and friends thereof. Participants must be at least 18 years old and you will be paid £5 for your time.

customsurveytitle: How to Spot a Smuggler - Smuggler Detection

posts.title: Recruiting line up members for an eyewitness identification study
posts.title_plain: Recruiting line up members for an eyewitness identification study
posts.content:
Researchers from the Department of Psychology are recruiting line up members for an eyewitness identification experiment. Participants would be video-recorded and photographed (recordings will serve as stimuli for eyewitness identification research), would act a brief staged theft, and then would appear in a live line up. Participants need to come on at least two days (see the date section) for a brief recording session in the morning, and then in the afternoon from 1 till 4pm.

Potential participants will be asked to send the research team a photograph of themselves and provide basic information about their appearance (e.g., age, ethnicity, hair colour, hair length, height, and build). This information will serve the research team to select participants of similar appearance for a specific day.

If you are interested or have any questions – please contact the research team immediately!

posts.title: Researching the effects of beetroot
posts.content:
The Extreme Environments Laboratory, Department of Sport and Exercise Science is looking for volunteers to participate in a research study looking at the effect of beetroot on skin blood vessel function and the responses of the hands and feet to mild cooling.

We are seeking healthy males and females aged between 18 and 59 years who are non-smokers and regularly exposed to cold conditions through windsurfing, surfing or open water swimming etc. throughout the year.

The study involves three visits to the lab which will last between 1½ and 2½ hours. On two of the visits you will be asked to drink two shots of beetroot juice or placebo. The testing involves a brief immersion of the hand and foot into 15°C water and a very small amount of vasoactive drug put on your skin to see how your skin blood vessels respond.

We are testing between 9 and 19 January inclusive as well as some days in February which have yet to be confirmed.

If you are interested and would like more information please contact us:

Clare Eglin clare.eglin@port.ac.uk (023 9284 5299)

Joe Costello joe.costello@port.ac.uk (023 9284 5366)

Ant Shepherd ant.shepherd@port.ac.uk (023 9284 5289)

customresearchtitle: Effect of concentrated beetroot juice on the responses to extremity cooling and endothelial function in cold-sensitive individuals
customdepartment: Department of Sport and Exercise Science

posts.title: Seeking black and ethnic minority particpant  for a online survey
posts.title_plain: Seeking black and ethnic minority particpant  for a online survey
posts.content:
I would like to invite you to take part in my research. My study will be exploring black and minority ethnic people’s attitudes towards mental health and how these attitudes relate to different people’s religious outlook. This is an online questionnaire, which should not take more than 20 minutes.

Please enter the survey here.

posts.title: Seeking participants for a short online survey
posts.title_plain: Seeking participants for a short online survey
posts.content:
We are currently conducting a project called Fit4Life as a part of our Project Management unit. As a part of this we are looking to see if there is a market for a platform where individuals or groups can sign up to do a physical activity, and ask others to donate towards Cancer Research UK, through an activity. The survey is aimed at students and staff and is completely anonymous.

If we can have two to three minutes of your time to complete this survey, it would be a great help!

Click here to access the survey.

Thank you very much in advance!

Elise Alaerts, Luca Schera and Sanna Eriksson Ryg

posts.title: Acting Tragedy
posts.content:
In this study we want to investigate how people process emotional information. We are looking for amateur or professional actors to take part.

There are many individual differences in coping with emotional situations, and one of the important factors is life events. You will be briefly pre-screened with a questionnaire about your life events history over the last six months. This will take approximately 15 minutes of your time but it will allow us to select participants who fit the criteria for the study. The procedure or the study is neutral and you will not be exposed to any stressful information.

After the pre-screening, participants who fit the criteria for the study will be called for the second part of the study which will take place at the Faculty of Science, King Henry’s building. In the study we will give you a scenario and your task would be to behave as if you actually experienced the described situation, and with that in mind to fill out questionnaires and do a computer task. Every participant will be rewarded with £10 for participation after they complete the study.

Please click here for the link to the pre-screening.

posts.title: How attractive are we?
posts.content: How attractive do we really believe ourselves to be? Do we see what other people see? This study is to investigate if people are able to see just how attractive they are. The study involves a short questionnaire, a picture and a survey. It literally takes ten minutes.

posts.title: Native Chinese Speakers Required
posts.content: In this study you and your friend will be allocated to one of two possible missions. Depending on the task you are allocated to you may be required to lie when later interviewed about your mission. We are also keen to see whether cultural attitudes influence friendship coherence and as such are looking for people who speak Chinese. If you take part you and your friend will earn £8 each as a thank you. Additionally all those who tell a convincing story to the interviewer will be entered into a draw to win one of three prizes (£200, £100, £50). The study will not take longer than 75 minutes.

posts.title: Deception Research
posts.content:
Researchers at the University of Portsmouth are interested in how memory fades over time, specifically the differences between this memory for truth tellers and liars.

In this study you will be allocated to one of two possible missions. Depending on which task you are allocated to, you may be required to lie when later interviewed about your mission. The study will be in two parts.

The first stage is comprised of the mission and interview (45-60 mins) and the second stage will be an interview two weeks later (20-30 mins).

All participants will be paid £10 for their participation. If you are able to tell a convincing story to the interviewer, you will be entered into a draw to win one of three possible prizes; £150, £100 and £50! The study will take part in King Henry Building.

customresearch: All participants will be paid £10 for their participation and all convincing interviewees will be entered into a draw to win one of three possible prizes; £150, £100 and £50!

posts.title: Identity Deception
posts.content:
Researchers at the University of Portsmouth are interested in false identity and our descriptions of past events, specifically the differences between such descriptions for truth tellers and liars.

In this study you will be allocated to one of two possible conditions. Depending on which task you are allocated to, you may be required to lie when later interviewed.

The study will take approximately 60-70 minutes (maximum) of your time, and will involve an interview. If you are interested in taking part, we will inform you of specific instructions and the condition in which you will be placed seven days before the study.

If you are able to tell a convincing story to the interviewer, you will be entered into a draw to win one of three possible prizes; £150, £100 and £50.
